comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC -- Title is skewed. This is Cork, the city -- not County Cork.

comment.author: 25757249@N07
comment._content: Affectionately known as Pana by older Corkonians. It has obviously changed a lot www.corkpastandpresent.ie/ Cork is the biggest county in Ireland and most Corkonians feel it really is the Capital of Ireland. If you're ever thinking of visiting Ireland it is well worth a trip with absolutely loads to do.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: LOC - I think it is more properly named "Saint Patrick's Street". Especially on March 17. Electric trams started in Cork in December 1898 - www.corkpastandpresent.ie/mapsimages/corkphotographs/cork... Wonderful picture btw!

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: This is print No. 12107 -- the 12000 series of the Photochrom Co Ltd prints was published around 1899 (I know the 13000 series with the Scottish motives was published in 1899, I haven't seen an Irish one with an exact publishing date yet, but it looks like we have an earliest date now...).

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks beachcomeraustralia, for pointing out the proper street name.  We'll add the correction to the title so it reads "St. Patrick Street" next time we update the record.  In the meantime, enjoy another view of the street in a photograph from a stereograph in our collection.  Enter this title into our online catalog: St. Patrick Street, the finest in Cork, Ireland.

comment._content: This only half of the streets length ...its Known as '' Pana ' and it looks pretty much the same today apart from the traffic .
